repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:    Error for invalid range when using listener and undo. (Paul Jolly)
Solution:   Do not change the cursor before the lines are restored.
            (closes vim/vim#4908)

https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/4544bd2f247425c9dd743c76618dd70f53c72538

<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

v8.2.0845 could be later until I figure out why exactly tests are failing.

comment_data.body: `-1` shouldn't matter here because of early `return FAIL;`
Rest of v8.2.0845 breaks legacy 068 test regardless of the above patch.

Not sure about this, but `ML_DEL_UNDO` actually doesn't do anything in Nvim...
```suggestion
  ML_DEL_UNDO = 2,     // called from undo
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -10,3 +10,16 @@
 
 /// LINEEMPTY() - return true if the line is empty
 #define LINEEMPTY(p) (*ml_get(p) == NUL)
+
+// Values for the flags argument of ml_delete_flags().
+enum {
+  ML_DEL_MESSAGE = 1,  // may give a "No lines in buffer" message
+  ML_DEL_UNDO = 2,     // called from undo, do not update textprops

comment_data.body:
Could comment it out or rename plus reassign to 0
or use `ml_delete()` with a comment for `ML_DEL_UNDO`
if no one else finds a use for it.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -10,3 +10,16 @@
 
 /// LINEEMPTY() - return true if the line is empty
 #define LINEEMPTY(p) (*ml_get(p) == NUL)
+
+// Values for the flags argument of ml_delete_flags().
+enum {
+  ML_DEL_MESSAGE = 1,  // may give a "No lines in buffer" message
+  ML_DEL_UNDO = 2,     // called from undo, do not update textprops

comment_regular_data.body:
`vim-patch:8.1.0688 text properties are not restored by undo`
doesn't seem N/A in the interest of porting v8.2.0844 and later patches. https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/26008

[vim-patch:8.1.0579](https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/98aefe7c3250bb5d4153b994f878594d1745424e) cannot attach properties to text
is not N/A for v8.2.0845. Helps to reduce/avoid `strlen()`.
I think the last two commits should be squashed into a single `refactor:` commit, as they are small changes that do not change behavior.

> I think the last two commits should be squashed into a single `refactor:` commit, as they are small changes that do not change behavior.

Split up the fixes and fixup-rebase-squash each fix to their respective patches.
Missed ML_APPEND_UNDO for the same reason ML_DEL_UNDO is commented out; both are for textprop so both flags are N/A.

title: vim-patch:8.1.2008,v8.2.{844,853,3348,3795,4379}
